Salary: Our people build skills for the future
Ad Text:
Company Description

KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

KPMG ThinkPay offers a multi-disciplinary team combining specialist capability across Risk, Assurance, Workplace Relations Advisory, Employment Law, Tax and Data Analytics all in one place. By drawing on our subject matter experts, KPMG is uniquely positioned to help you navigate the complexities of your payroll environment.

Job Description

With continued growth, we are looking to recruit an experienced Manager to join our ThinkPay team.

As a valued member of the KPMG ThinkPay team, you will have accountability for:

Delivering leading edge data analytics and remediation activities leveraging specialist knowledge of different payroll and HR systems.

Contributing data-driven insights to help our make important business decisions and minimise risks around employee entitlements.

Collaborating with a team of multi-disciplinary specialists, including legal, systems, governance and risk consulting and behavioural risk, to bring fit-for-purpose solutions.

Mentoring and leading data analytics teams.

How are you extraordinary?

You are someone with:

Experience in client relationship management

Deep understanding of payroll and people analytics, payroll processes, time and attendance systems is advantageous

Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python; experience with Azure and cloud-based analytics platforms is highly regarded.

Good understanding of modern awards, enterprise agreements, superannuation, leave entitlements is advantageous

Qualifications

STEM degree in the field of Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics

Additional Information

KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth. 

Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who’ve got your back. You’ll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture.

At KPMG, you’ll take control over how you work. We’re embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Attraction Support Team.

At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.

Salary: Our people build skills for the future
Ad Text:
Company Description

KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

KPMG ThinkPay offers a multi-disciplinary team combining specialist capability across Risk, Assurance, Workplace Relations Advisory, Employment Law, Tax and Data Analytics all in one place. By drawing on our subject matter experts, KPMG is uniquely positioned to help you navigate the complexities of your payroll environment.

Job Description

Due to continued growth, we are seeking an experienced Associate Director to join our ThinkPay team within the Enterprise Advisory division. This is a leadership role that will see you managing high-impact consulting engagements and guiding clients through complex payroll and workforce compliance challenges.

Key Responsibilities

Lead and deliver complex consulting engagements across data analytics, payroll remediation, workforce compliance.

Act as a trusted advisor to clients, managing relationships and providing strategic insights.

Drive risk management and remediation programs with a focus on quality and impact.

Mentor and lead multidisciplinary teams, fostering capability and professional growth.

How are you extraordinary?

You are a strategic thinker and problem solver with a passion for delivering value through data and advisory services. You bring:

Strong data analytics skills, including cleansing, modelling, and insights generation.

Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python; experience with Azure and cloud-based analytics platforms is highly regarded.

Strong project management skills, ideally with experience in remediation programs.

Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement capabilities.

Proven experience in data analytics, payroll remediation, workforce compliance, or broader consulting.

Background in a Big 4, mid-tier, or boutique consulting firm, or experience in data teams within large organisations.

Qualifications

STEM degree in the field of Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics.

Additional Information

KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth. 

Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who’ve got your back. You’ll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture.

At KPMG, you’ll take control over how you work. We’re embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Attraction Support Team.

At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.

Salary: Our people build skills for the future
Ad Text:
Company Description

KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

KPMG ThinkPay offers a multi-disciplinary team combining specialist capability across Risk, Assurance, Workplace Relations Advisory, Employment Law, Tax and Data Analytics all in one place. By drawing on our subject matter experts, KPMG is uniquely positioned to help you navigate the complexities of your payroll environment.

Job Description

With continued growth, we are looking to recruit an experienced Director to join our ThinkPay team. This is a senior leadership role responsible for shaping and delivering high-impact advisory solutions, driving innovation, and building trusted client relationships across complex payroll and workforce compliance matters.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the strategic direction and delivery of large-scale consulting engagements across payroll remediation, workforce compliance, and data-driven risk management.

Oversee multidisciplinary teams, fostering a high-performance culture and mentoring future leaders.

Drive business development initiatives, contributing to market growth and client acquisition.

Ensure quality, compliance, and excellence across all engagements, with a focus on sustainable outcomes.

How are you extraordinary?
You are a strategic thinker with a passion for solving complex problems through data, technology, and advisory excellence. You bring:

Deep expertise in data analytics, including cleansing, modelling, and insight generation.

Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python; experience with Azure and cloud-based analytics platforms is highly regarded.

Proven track record in leading remediation programs and managing large-scale projects.

Exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to influence at senior levels.

Experience in a Big 4, mid-tier, or boutique consulting firm, or in a senior data or compliance role within a large organisation.

Qualifications

STEM degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics.

Additional Information

KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth. 

Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who’ve got your back. You’ll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture.

At KPMG, you’ll take control over how you work. We’re embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Attraction Support Team.

At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.

Are you a commercially savvy finance professional with a passion for driving performance outcomes through analytics, insights, and strategic partnerships? Do you thrive in dynamic environments where your expertise can shape the future of an organisation? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join a leading organisation as a Finance Performance Partner.

The Role

As a Finance Performance Partner, you will play a pivotal role in fostering trusted relationships with Executive Leaders, Senior Managers, and key stakeholders. You will provide constructive advice and challenge business-driven decision-making to achieve sustainable performance outcomes. This role is integral to driving improved performance through analytics, insights, and collaboration.

Key Responsibilities
Lead the development of functional business area planning strategies aligned with enterprise goals.
Provide financial insights to guide strategic planning decisions and contribute to board-level discussions.
Develop compelling business cases to justify project investments and articulate return on investment.
Ensure accuracy in project benefits management and monitor post-implementation reviews.
Deliver complex analyses of performance data to identify trends and actionable insights.
Design and execute reporting strategies using storytelling techniques to present insights effectively.
Partner with executives and senior leaders to align financial strategies with organizational goals.
Advise on commercial concepts including financial, regulatory, and benchmarking opportunities.
Uplift financial accountability across all levels of the business by fostering a performance-focused mindset.
About You

To excel in this role, you will be an experienced finance professional with strong analytical skills and the ability to build trusted relationships across all levels of the organisation. You will bring:

A degree qualification in Finance, Accounting or similar field. CPA/CA qualification or equivalent is essential.
Substantial experience (6-10 years) in a commercial finance environment within a large, complex business.
Proven ability to plan, manage resources, and deliver results within short/medium timescales.
Strong commercial acumen with expertise in budgeting, forecasting, data analytics, and strategic planning.
Exceptional stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence decision-making at senior levels.
Proficiency in creating compelling reports and dashboards that drive actionable insights.
A growth mindset with the ability to learn from challenges and adapt quickly to change.
Whats on offer

This role offers an excellent opportunity for career progression within a forward-thinking organisation that values innovation and collaboration. In addition to a competitive salary package, benefits include:

Opportunities for professional development.
Comprehensive benefits such as pension contributions, healthcare plans, wellness leave, free lunches, travel reimbursement, and more.
How to Apply

If you're ready to take on this exciting challenge and make a lasting impact on our clients organisation's success, we'd love to hear from you! Please submit your CV and lets chat further around this opportunity.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Hamish Winterbourn on +61 7 30322282 for a confidential discussion.

Come grow with us.

The Senior Business Analyst plays a key role in the ANZ FP&A team, acting as a business partner to ANZ’s Business Lines and Support Functions and working closely with ANZ’s Finance Teams.

How you’ll make a difference

Playing a key role in supporting the annual plan and the monthly close/outlook & pipeline processes and monitoring the quality and integrity of data across our financial systems.

Utilise business intelligence tools to provide the most efficient platform to produce one version of the truth reporting and analysis presented in the most value adding formats

Assist with monthly reporting and commentary on actuals, capturing key variances, trends and risks/opportunities.

Support the FP&A Director through provision of ad-hoc analysis, including effective presentation of data and insightful commentary and recommendations.

Monthly review of ANZ’s pipeline sources, balances and activity for quality and accuracy, along with the provision of analysis/commentary capturing key wins, bookings and adjustments.

Analyse end-to-end business processes to identify automation opportunities using AI, RPA, and machine learning technologies.

Develop process maps, requirements, and documentation for automation initiatives




Qualifications




The following qualifications and experience are highly desired, but if you don’t tick all the boxes you could still be a perfect fit for this role. Please apply, all applications will be considered.

Accounting/Commerce/Finance degree or similar

Previous experience with ERP, COGNOS/TM1 + Power BI

Previous experience with AI-powered automation and RPA tools (UiPath, Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, Power Automate, etc.).

Demonstrated ability to analyse and present financial information across a range of business areas in a manner which ensures that key messages are clear and readily understood by managers with both financial and non- financial backgrounds

Previous experience in a business analyst or finance partnering role, with demonstrated experience developing relationships with operational leaders (and other internal/external clients) and influencing business decisions and outcomes




Additional information




Why you’ll love working with us

Flexible work arrangements, including alternative start/finish times, part-time, job-sharing and hybrid work options

Purchase up to 6 weeks additional annual leave per year     

Flex public holidays – swap Easter or other holidays for ones that suit you better

Continuous learning and growth - lunch and learns, professional development courses, financial study assistance, 5 days paid study leave, global career opportunities

AECOM acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which we, our clients and our communities live and work around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. We are committed to connecting to Country in our work through meaningful engagement with First Nations peoples and businesses.  Find out more about our Australian Reconciliation Action Plan here: https://aecom.com/au/our-vision-for-reconciliation/.

About AECOM

AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $16.1 billion in fiscal year 2024. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.

Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity 

You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.

Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

About the Role

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented PMO Analyst / Demand & Portfolio Coordinator to join our dynamic Project Management Office. In this pivotal role, you'll help shape how project demand, resources, and financials are managed across the portfolio - ensuring strategic alignment, transparency, and operational excellence.

You'll work closely with business units, delivery leads, and finance teams to translate business needs into actionable plans, optimise resource utilisation, and drive continuous improvement across project delivery practices.

Key Responsibilities

Demand Management

Collaborate with business units to capture, assess, and prioritise new project and initiative requests.

Maintain and enhance the demand intake process to ensure alignment with strategic goals.

Facilitate demand planning sessions and governance forums, providing relevant reporting and insights.

Identify and manage demand-related risks, issues, and dependencies.

Promote clear communication and collaboration across business and project stakeholders throughout the demand lifecycle.

Resource Allocation

Develop and maintain resource capacity models across teams and projects.

Monitor and report on utilisation, availability, and conflicts.

Partner with delivery leads and functional managers to ensure effective and efficient resource deployment.

Financial Management

Track and manage budgets, forecasts, and actuals across the project portfolio.

Support annual budgeting and quarterly financial reviews.

Deliver financial reporting and analysis to support decision-making and cost control.

Work with Finance to ensure accurate cost centre alignment and financial compliance.

Reporting & Insights

Produce dashboards and reports on demand pipeline, resource utilisation, and financial performance.

Analyse data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities - presenting actionable insights to leadership.

Change & Process Improvement

Champion process optimisation, automation, and standardisation within the PMO.

Enhance PMO methodologies and maintain tools, templates, and artefacts for project delivery.

Lead post-project evaluations to capture lessons learned and promote continuous improvement.

Open Communication & Collaboration

Demonstrate initiative, innovation, and a commitment to quality.

Share knowledge and ideas openly, supporting a culture of transparency and continuous learning.

About You

You're a motivated and collaborative PMO professional with a strong foundation in project and portfolio management. You thrive on structure, data-driven insights, and bringing clarity to complex initiatives. You're comfortable working across teams, balancing priorities, and supporting decision-making at all levels.

Qualifications & Experience

Essential:

5+ years of experience in a PMO, project coordinator/manager role.

Strong understanding of project lifecycle, portfolio management, and resource planning.

Proven financial management experience within a project or program context.

Proficiency with tools such as Jira, SharePoint, SAP, MS Project, Power BI, Excel, and portfolio management systems (e.g., Clarity, Planview, or similar).

Excellent communication, stakeholder engagement, and analytical skills.

Desirable:

Experience in commercial business case modelling.

Prio experience in Financial Services or Telco.

Position Overview

We are seeking a strategic and technically skilled Senior Project Manager to lead advanced HR data analytics, workforce planning, and cross-functional coordination across enterprise platforms. This role will support executive decision-making through robust reporting, data governance, and stakeholder engagement, while ensuring seamless operational transition and compliance.

Key Responsibilities
Lead development of HR dashboards and reports using tools such as Power BI, Calumo, and Snowflake.
Manage data integrations across platforms including Workday, Ascender, and Adaptive Planning.
Ensure data governance, quality assurance, and role-based security models are in place.
Drive workforce planning and position management aligned with financial forecasting.
Support cost variance analysis and executive-level reporting (e.g., EG and EG-1 dashboards).
Collaborate with Finance to optimise use of Adaptive Planning for budget cycles.
Coordinate deliverables across multiple program streams including Staff Analytics, HR Establishment, and Academic Workload Planning.
Manage interdependencies and ensure alignment with strategic objectives.
Facilitate engagement with HR, Finance, IT, BIR, and Health stakeholders.
Lead working groups, steering committees, and reference groups.
Track benefits, ensure audit compliance, and report to regulatory bodies (e.g., TEFMA, UniForum, TASCI).

Qualifications & Experience
Proven experience in HR data analytics and workforce planning in large, complex environments.
Higher Education industry experience
Strong technical proficiency in Power BI, Snowflake, Adaptive Planning, and enterprise HR systems.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage executive-level reporting.
Experience in change management, governance, and compliance frameworks.
Excellent communication, stakeholder engagement, and project coordination skills.

If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. For further information please contact Cevina Feng at Clicks IT Recruitment on +61 425 106 599.

At Clicks, we embrace diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity.At Clicks we embrace diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity. First Nations people are encouraged to apply.

We provide reasonable adjustments, including alternate formats to the recruitment process for individuals with a disability. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process, please call 1300 254 257 or email adjustments@clicks.com.au

Take hold of a monster opportunity and join our Transformation team as a Reporting Analyst.  If you’re a good fit for this role and live in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne, we’d love you to apply. 

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role

We’re all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. As a Reporting Analyst you’ll play a pivotal role in supporting data-driven decision-making and governance across a large-scale, complex transformation initiative.

 

Day to day, you'll:

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports tracking key performance indicators, project milestones, RAIDs, and other program metrics for a major, multi-faceted transformation project.
Extract, transform, and analyse data from various systems to support reporting requirements in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment.
Collaborate with TMO, Delivery, and Enterprise stakeholders to understand reporting needs and deliver tailored solutions that address the challenges of a large-scale program.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across all reporting outputs, supporting critical decision-making for a complex project landscape.
Support the development and automation of reporting processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort, enabling the program to scale effectively.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of reporting frameworks, tools, and templates to meet the evolving needs of a dynamic transformation initiative.
Maintain documentation of reporting processes, data sources, and definitions.
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support management decision-making within a complex program structure.
Ensure compliance with ART’s data governance and security protocols.
Prepare reports for regulators and governance forums, including executive and board-level committees.

This role is a permanent opportunity. 

About you

It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to identify and pick up problems to come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you tick some of the following boxes too:  

Experience in reporting, data analysis, or business intelligence within a project or transformation environment - ideally on large-scale, complex programs, preferably within the financial services sector.
Proficiency in reporting and data visualisation tools.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and present insights clearly.
Experience working with project management tools and data sources.
Tertiary qualifications in Business, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data quality.

About us

Our 2.4 million members trust us to take care of over $330 billion in retirement savings. And we help them take charge of their finances and face the future with confidence. Our inclusive culture means you’ll be valued and heard in a respectful workplace. We've created an environment where you can be yourself and do amazing work. It's that simple.

Apply online now

Everyone is welcome to apply. We value diverse thinking, cultures, perspectives, backgrounds, and abilities. Awaken your career at Australian Retirement Trust and apply now. Applications close Wednesday, 19 November 2025. 

We don’t want to leave you with a monstrous wait. So, you’ll hear from us after the closing date to find out whether you’ve made it through to the next round or not. Being fair and up-front is important to us – and recruitment is no different.

Your new company


Join a dynamic and forward-thinking government department committed to addressing climate change, promoting sustainable energy practices, and safeguarding our environment and water resources. This role supports a regulatory agency responsible for ensuring compliance with national water laws and promoting transparent, accountable water management across jurisdictions.




Your new role


This department is seeking a highly capable and strategic Records and Information Management Specialist to lead the review, redesign, and implementation of the division's records management framework for 12 weeks with the view for extension commencing January 2026. This role supports a regulatory agency responsible for ensuring compliance with national water laws and promoting transparent, accountable water management across jurisdictions.


The successful candidate will play a key role in strengthening the agency's information governance, ensuring that recordkeeping practices are efficient, compliant, and adaptable to future systems and technologies.

Your duties will include but are not limited to:

Lead the review and analysis of the current records management structure in Content Manager, identifying gaps, inefficiencies, and compliance risks.
Engage with internal stakeholders to understand current and future recordkeeping needs, workflows, and operational requirements.
Ensure all proposed changes align with relevant legislation, National Archives of Australia (NAA) standards, and internal agency policies.
Design a new records file structure (classification scheme/taxonomy) that supports future system transitions, including potential migration to SharePoint.
Develop a detailed implementation plan outlining key steps, responsibilities, and timelines for transition.
Draft a Records and Information Management Plan for the division, aligned with the agency's governance framework and templates.


What you'll need to succeed


This role requires prior experience within the APS at the EL1 level.


To succeed in this role, you will:



Demonstrate experience in records and information management within a government or regulatory environment.
Have a strong understanding of Content Manager and SharePoint, including system design and classification structures.
Show proven knowledge of relevant legislation and NAA standards governing records management.
Have proven ability to lead projects, manage competing priorities, and deliver outcomes within tight timeframes.
Demonstrate excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate across teams.
Have experience in developing governance documentation and implementation strategies.
You must be an Australian citizen and will possess or be willing to go through the process to obtain and maintain a (Baseline, NV1 or NV2) personnel security clearance.


Desirable Qualifications:

Formal qualifications in Records Management, Information Management, or a related discipline.
Experience in change management and capability building within a records or information governance context.


What you'll get in return


A challenging and rewarding role within a supportive team.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
The chance to make a meaningful impact on environmental policies.
An attractive hourly rate



What you need to do now


If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV or call or email Laura Meyer on (02) 6112 7654, Laura.Meyer@hays.com.au
If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

We are Reckitt

Home to the world's best loved and trusted hygiene, health, and nutrition brands. Our purpose defines why we exist: to protect, heal and nurture in the relentless pursuit of a cleaner, healthier world. We are a global team united by this purpose. Join us in our fight to make access to the highest quality hygiene, wellness, and nourishment a right and not a privilege.

​Information Technology & Digital​

In IT&D, you'll be a force for good, whether you're championing cyber security, defining how we harness the power of technology to improve our business, or working with data to guide the innovation of consumer loved products.

Working globally across functions, you'll own your projects and process from start to finish, with the influence and visibility to achieve what needs to be done. And if you're willing to bring your ideas to the table, you'll get the support and investment to make them happen.

Your potential will never be wasted. You'll get the space and support to take your development to the next level. Every day, there will be opportunities to learn from peers and leaders through working on exciting, varied projects with real impact. And because our work spans so many different businesses, from Research and Product Development to Sales, you'll keep learning exciting new approaches.

About the role

Explore the forefront of purposeful technology and innovation as a Senior IT & D Business Analyst at Reckitt. Within our collaborative IT & Digital team, every day is a chance to create meaningful impact. Here, you'll be ensuring excellence across a global network that's dedicated to a cleaner, healthier world. If you possess a blend of strategic thinking and technical expertise, and you're ready to transform business needs into cutting-edge IT & D solutions, we would love to hear from you. Be the catalyst for change in a company committed to making a difference.

Your responsibilities

The Senior IT&D Business Analyst will provide a combination of commercial and technical expertise while also providing leadership to the business from an IT&D angle and on projects involving assessment, design, development and implementation of business solutions. A Senior IT&D Business Analyst will typically manage both internal customer groups (often up to executive level), vendors & other internal support groups to ensure a smooth delivery of service.

The experience we're looking for

Proficient in analysing requirements and translating business processes into clear specifications.

Experience within the FMCG/Consumer Goods industry strongly preferred.

Familiar with manufacturing processes & Commercial technology and a deep understanding of IT systems, cybersecurity, and data analytics.

Well-versed in project and programme management, design thinking, and IT service management.

Strong commercial acumen and ability wo work within a highly matrixed organisation.

Skilled in change management practises with a focus on stakeholder relationship management and user adoption.

Strong communication skills, capable of advising and guiding diverse teams and stakeholders.

What we offer

With inclusion at the heart of everything we do, working alongside our four global Employee Resource Groups, we support our people at every step of their career journey, helping them to succeed in their own individual way. We invest in the wellbeing of our people through parental benefits, an Employee Assistance Program to promote mental health, and life insurance for all employees globally. We have a range of other benefits in line with the local market. Through our global share plans we offer the opportunity to save and share in Reckitt's potential future successes. For eligible roles, we also offer short-term incentives to recognise, appreciate and reward your work for delivering outstanding results. You will be rewarded in line with Reckitt's pay for performance philosophy.

Equality

We recognise that in real life, great people don't always 'tick all the boxes'. That's why we hire for potential as well as experience. Even if you don't meet every point on the job description, if this role and our company feels like a good fit for you, we still want to hear from you. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, disability or medical condition; colour, ethnicity, race, citizenship, and national origin; religion, faith; pregnancy, family status and caring responsibilities; sexual orientation; sex, gender identity, gender expression, and transgender identity; protected veteran status; size or any other basis protected by appropriate law.

Join the Team at Adica Insurance 

Where people come first and possibilities follow 

About the Opportunity 

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Business Analyst – Guidewire Implementation to join our team on a 14-month fixed-term contract, with the potential for extension based on project needs and performance. This role offers a hybrid working model and sits within our Strategy Implementation & Change team, supporting the successful delivery of one of Adica’s most significant transformation programs.

As a key liaison between business stakeholders and delivery teams, you’ll play a critical role in eliciting, analysing, and documenting business requirements to ensure solutions are aligned with both operational needs and strategic objectives. You’ll work closely with internal teams and external partners to support process mapping and validation activities across Guidewire InsuranceSuite implementations including PolicyCenter, BillingCenter, and ClaimCenter.

What You’ll Be Responsible For

Facilitating workshops and stakeholder interviews to understand business needs, issues, and expectations. 

Analysing data, processes, and systems to clearly articulate findings and support informed decision-making. 

Identifying, gathering, and documenting business requirements and translating them into technical specifications. 

Defining clear acceptance criteria and supporting the development of test plans and cases. 

Collaborating with Guidewire delivery teams to ensure processes are understood and implemented correctly. 

Supporting end-user training and providing post-implementation support. 

Monitoring and communicating progress of change requests to manage stakeholder expectations. 

Preparing and maintaining high-quality documentation to support delivery transparency and governance. 

Contributing to continuous improvement in business analysis practices and stakeholder engagement. 

What You’ll Bring 

Solid understanding of general insurance operations, standards, and regulatory requirements. 

Extensive experience as a Business Analyst, with a proven ability to manage large-scale business change initiatives. 

Strong interpersonal and written communication skills, with a proactive approach to problem-solving. 

Proficiency in business analysis tools and techniques, and the ability to coach others to deliver high-quality outcomes. 

Experience working with systems and data, with the ability to quickly learn and adapt to new platforms. 

Familiarity with Guidewire modules (PolicyCenter, BillingCenter, ClaimCenter) is highly desirable. 

Understanding of Agile delivery practices and tools (e.g. JIRA, Confluence). 

Experience working with cross-functional teams and external vendors. 

Ability to apply holistic, tactical, and strategic thinking to guide decision-making and solution design. 

Experience in the insurance industry or other regulated environments is advantageous. 

Why You’ll Love Working at Adica 

At Adica, our people are our greatest asset. We’re proud to be recognised as an Employer of Choice, committed to flexibility, wellbeing, and personal growth. Here’s a taste of what we offer: 

Big discounts on car insurance for you and your family 

14 weeks Paid Parental Leave for all parents, plus superannuation on both paid and unpaid leave (up to 52 weeks) 

Quarterly Wellbeing Leave days and the ability to swap Public Holidays 

A supportive Wellbeing Program and year-round employee events 

Monthly recognition awards and annual Excellence Awards 

Strong culture of internal progression and career development 

Access to the Go1 learning platform with thousands of courses 

Leadership development with Hello Monday to support your growth 

Hybrid working model – the best of both worlds 

Employee Assistance Program (EAP) free, 24/7 support for you and your family 

...and more, because your wellbeing truly matters to us 

 Who We Are  

Adica Insurance is an Australian-operated and regulated general insurer, backed by the global strength of the MS&AD Insurance Group, one of the world’s top 20 insurance and financial services groups.  

Adica exists to make insurance more human, more helpful, more transparent, and more empowering for our customers. We support our people with the same care and clarity. Together, we’re creating a workplace where people thrive, teams collaborate, and customers feel truly supported.  

What to Expect from Us  

We’re committed to creating an inclusive and accessible workplace. Once you apply, our Talent Team will review your application. If you're shortlisted, we'll reach out for a phone chat, followed by one interview. We’ll keep you updated throughout because clarity matters.   

If you require any adjustments during the recruitment process, please let your recruiting contact know when they first reach out.

ASAP start
Contract until June 2026 with 2 x 12 months extension
Canberra based
Hybrid arrangement
Australian Citizens ONLY
Baseline security clearance required

Ad Text:
Theme Head - Research (EL 2)

- Child and Family Wellbeing

- Child and Family Safety

- Families and Society

Ongoing – Full-time

Location - Melbourne, VIC 

We are seeking highly motivated individuals with demonstrated senior leadership experience, who can bring their strategic planning, business development and stakeholder management skills and expertise in social sciences.

The Theme Head will play an instrumental role in leading the achievement of complex research projects, providing strategic leadership to drive the Institute’s research agenda.  

About us

The Australian Institute of Family Studies (AIFS, or ‘the Institute’) is the Australian Government's key research advisory agency in the area of family wellbeing. It is an independent statutory authority established in 1980 under the Family Law Act 1975. It is also home to the Australian Gambling Research Centre (AGRC), established under the Gambling Measures Act 2012 which builds the evidence base on gambling-related harm. The Institute is an agency within the portfolio of the Department of Social Services (DSS).

AIFS’ approach to research is applied and policy relevant, coming from a tradition of social science and strengthened by our multidisciplinary expertise. We draw together expertise from a broad range of disciplines including sociology, psychology, social work, economics, political science, demography, law, public health and data science. Our research is generated through a combination of AIFS initiated and commissioned projects.

Our AIFS initiated and led research allows us to respond to critical trends and emerging issues for families in Australia and contribute independent insights to inform policy and practice.

Our commissioned research for government departments and agencies addresses specific policy questions and program needs, drawing on our multidisciplinary research expertise and methodological rigour.

About our Themes

As a Theme Head at AIFS, you will be expected to demonstrate deep policy and research expertise in one of the Institute’s key research areas, depending on the theme you are applying for. 

Research Themes

There are 4 key research themes related to our core legislative functions. The first 3 themes apply to our core function as the leading Institution for family studies in Australia. 

1. Child and Family Wellbeing

2. Child and Family Safety

3. Families and Society

4. Gambling Harm

AIFS has a secondary function under the Gambling Measures Act 2012.

Enabled under the Family Law Act 1975, AIFS is the leading institution for family studies in Australia. 

Position Requirements

The Theme Head is a senior research leadership role responsible for the strategic and scientific direction of a designated research theme at AIFS. This role ensures the delivery of high-quality, policy-relevant evidence that informs government decision-making and contributes to improved outcomes for children, families, and communities.

The Theme Head sets the vision for the theme, leads strategic planning, and ensures alignment with AIFS’s Strategic Research Agenda. They are accountable for the coherence, innovation, and impact of research within the theme, and contribute to cross-theme collaboration and strategic initiatives.

This role involves managing senior researchers and research teams, fostering a collaborative and high-performing research culture, and supporting career development. The Theme Head actively engages with senior government officials and external stakeholders to influence policy and translate research into practice.

Strong commercial acumen and business development capabilities are essential, including leading large-scale funding proposals, identifying strategic opportunities, and building partnerships that support the Institute’s long-term objectives. 

The Theme Head maintains an active research profile and contributes to the scientific leadership of AIFS. This includes active networking and promotion of AIFS work both in person as well as through key channels such as LinkedIn. 

Key Responsibilities of the position:

Strategic Leadership

• Leads specific theme strategy and sets vision and direction for this area.

• Works collectively with other Theme Heads and leaders of our longitudinal studies to:

- lead the AIFS Strategic Research Agenda, jointly considering all current and future research work to ensure it aligns to AIFS priorities

- configure and lead multi-disciplinary teams from across the theme streams as required to progress research and evidence projects

- champion a collective capability mindset that enables a OneAIFS approach to all work

Policy Engagement

• Provides expert analysis of policy environment as relevant to their Theme to inform strategic direction of work.

• Displays policy-relevant research leadership and consulting-style responsiveness to government needs.

• Liaises, consults and negotiates with counterparts in Government, sector and other groups in policy areas relevant to the research theme.

Research Excellence and Innovation

• Designs and directs high-quality, policy-relevant research and evidence projects that align with the Strategic Research Agenda

• Ensures research quality and innovation.

• Works closely with other Theme Heads to ensure a coherent style and approach to all research products.

Operational Oversight

• Works closely with other Theme Heads and leaders of our longitudinal studies and the Executive Leadership Team.

• Oversees theme-level operations and scientific quality, with ultimate accountability for ensuring projects run to time, cost and quality requirements. 

• Ensures consistent use of project management tools and templates by teams so that all research projects across AIFS are undertaken to the same standards.

• Maintains expert knowledge in relevant areas and provides advice and technical expertise to guide project and program activities.

• Collaborate with the AIFS Privacy Team to incorporate privacy practices into all work.

Stakeholder Engagement

• Represents theme externally; builds partnerships by communicating the strategic direction and vision of the Institute to stakeholders.

• Complex stakeholder engagement resolving conflict and managing sensitivities.

Business Development

• Represents theme externally; builds partnerships.

• Leads large-scale tenders and proposals.

• Manages strategic business development aligned with organisational and government priorities.

• Builds business development from initial leads and/or existing work.

Team Leadership

• Manages senior researchers; builds team culture.

Essential Criteria

· Deep knowledge of the policy environment for the relevant Strategic Research Agenda theme

· Demonstrated experience in leading strategic, policy-relevant research or evidence 

· Strong strategic planning and leadership skills 

· Proven ability to lead and build high-performing teams 

· Excellent stakeholder engagement skills

· Experience in business development

· Strong communication and interpersonal skills

· Commitment to diversity, inclusion, and culturally safe practices

For a comprehensive overview of the Essential Criteria, please see the Job Description for more information. 

Position Eligibility Requirements

To be eligible for engagement, applicants must be Australian citizens unless special approval is granted in exceptional circumstances. For example, applicants with permanent resident status who have applied for Australian citizenship may be considered for engagement.

Conditions of engagement including probation, health and character clearances (including police records check, Working with Children Check and security clearance) may apply to this position. 

Terms

The Theme Head position may be offered as a full-time ongoing role at the EL2 level. This will be with an annual salary range of between $137,125 to $160,757 depending on the skills and experience of the successful candidate, plus 15.4% superannuation. Our salaries and conditions of employment are set out in our Enterprise Agreement.

Application information

Please visit: Work with us | Australian Institute of Family Studies for full application requirements. 

For your application to be considered, please: 

1. Complete the Application Form.

2. Submit a current resume/CV detailing your recent employment history.  

3. Provide a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) pitch telling us why you are the best person for the job by outlining your skills, knowledge and experience against the 'Key Responsibilities' and 'Essential Criteria' – refer to the Job Description and Job Pack.

4. Please indicate which of the following Research themes you are applying for on your application:

- Child and Family Wellbeing

- Child and Family Safety

- Families and Society

Applications for this position close at 11.59 PM on 26 November 2025.

Contact: Human Resources

Contact Phone: 03 9214 7888

Contact Email: jobs@aifs.gov.au

Position notes

AIFS is committed to providing an inclusive and diverse workplace. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability, mature age people, those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people who identify as LGBTQIA+, and people with parenting and/or caring responsibilities.

We provide a collaborative and family-friendly work environment that supports the wellbeing and professional development of our diverse workforce. Benefits include workplace health and wellbeing initiatives and events, a hybrid flexible work arrangement policy, a good health promotion allowance and Christmas closedown period with no deduction from leave credits.

The Company

Our client is a high profile owner/operator/builder of large scale energy infrastructure assets valued in the billions. Growth orientated with a highly regarded executive leadership team in place, they continue to build on their position of strength through large scale CAPEX investment programs and an aggressive acquisition strategy.

The Role

The Group FP&A team is responsible for providing timely and efficient group budgeting, forecasting and analysis to the Exec to drive Company Performance and Strategic Insight.

Key Responsibilities

• Assist with the Annual budget, business plan and periodic forecasting submissions to Senior Management and the Board.
• Supports completion of the monthly Management Accounts, including review and financial performance analysis.
• Ad-hoc analysis to support strategic business investments and initiatives.
• Financial management and analysis of key group KPIs.
• Drive continuous process improvement.
• Provide ad-hoc analysis to support existing and growing business units.

The Successful Applicant.

• CA/CPA qualification
• Proven budgeting, forecasting and financial planning experience.
• Experience in providing financial analysis to support decision making.
• Strong financial modelling skills with advanced Excel.
• Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Trent Cairns 02 9164 6660

WorkCover Queensland have been providing workers’ compensation insurance across Queensland for more than 20 years and are dedicated to supporting Queensland workers and businesses, from managing claims and rehabilitation, to injury prevention and ensuring employers have the right cover to protect their teams. As a government-owned but self-funded organisation, WorkCover Queensland’s commitment is to delivering fair, efficient and compassionate support, understanding that every worker and business is different, and keeping premiums low for employers while helping injured workers achieve the best possible return-to-work outcomes. With a vision to be the best workers’ compensation insurer and make a positive difference to people’s lives, WorkCover Queensland partner with and support their customers to keep Queenslanders working.

To enable this vision and support the delivery of the organisation’s aspirations and strategic roadmap of project and transformation, WorkCover Queensland are seeking an experienced leader for the role of Head of Product and Actuarial. This role will be a key leader within the organisation, contributing to WorkCover Queensland’s ongoing transformation journey and measuring outcomes to sustain continued growth.
  
About the role

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, the Head of Product and Actuarial oversees four critical portfolios: pricing and compliance analytics, business insights and actuarial, premium support and strategy, and customer audit and intelligence.
Specifically, this role will:

Lead and develop a high-performing analytical and actuarial team, driving advanced modelling, projections and predictive analytics to optimise insurance risk and support pricing and valuation reviews.
Shape and oversee WorkCover’s product, pricing and actuarial functions, integrating financial, operational and data insights to inform strategic decisions and ensure fair, sustainable premiums.
Act as a trusted advisor to the CFO and Executive Leadership Team, providing expert guidance on actuarial strategy, operational challenges, and emerging risks to strengthen financial integrity and business performance.
Champion continuous improvement and innovation, enhancing data accuracy, pricing systems, reporting capability, and operational efficiency across product and actuarial processes.
Foster strong partnerships internally and externally including with the regulator, State Actuary, and key industry stakeholders to ensure clear, transparent communication of financial performance, compliance, and pricing outcomes.
Lead engagement on premium strategy, scheme sustainability, and policy reform to reinforce WorkCover’s leadership and reputation within the Queensland workers’ compensation landscape.
Key to the success of this role will be the ability to innovate and bring a customer-focused mindset, communicate with influence, and apply a pragmatic and commercial lens to judgement and decision-making. This role will be empowered to create and drive solutions that enable long-term partnerships and align to WorkCover Queensland’s regulatory obligations and strategic direction.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will be a highly experienced, strategic actuarial and business leader with proven expertise in overseeing product and actuarial functions, ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks, governance standards, and WorkCover Queensland’s operational objectives. You will possess deep knowledge of the financial services sector and a strong understanding of the commercial, regulatory, and socio-political factors influencing the organisation and its stakeholders. You will demonstrate exceptional analytical and actuarial capabilities, including developing and implementing statistical and predictive models, evaluating complex policy and legislative frameworks, and using data-driven insights to guide strategic decision-making.

A proven leader of high-performing, cross-functional teams, you excel in guiding senior executives through complex business transformations, capability enhancements, and operational improvements and have demonstrated experience in producing strategic position papers and influencing executive and Board-level stakeholders to align diverse perspectives, inform enterprise-wide strategy, and deliver sustainable, measurable business outcomes.

Tertiary qualifications in business, actuarial science or a related discipline complemented by postgraduate qualifications in actuarial studies and/or membership of the Institute of Actuaries (or equivalent) is essential for this role.

If you’re a strategic actuarial leader ready to shape the future of WorkCover Queensland and make a tangible impact on workers, businesses, and the community, we encourage you to apply.
  
Please visit the detailed candidate page for further information and to apply: www.luminarypartners.com.au/workcover-ho
  
Confidential inquiries to:
Elena Ryan, Senior Associate, Luminary on 0422 584 231 or via email elena.ryan@luminarypartners.com.au

General inquiries to luminary@luminarypartners.com.au
  
Applications close: Midnight, Tuesday 18th November 2025

Luminary is committed to storing and utilising your information in accordance with the Privacy Act 1988. For further information regarding this please visit: https://www.luminarypartners.com.au/privacy-policy

Salary: Competitive salary plus fantastic company benefits
Ad Text:
Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We’re on a mission to make flying better than ‘nice’. And to do that, it takes a team of talented people who are passionate about customer experience, doing the right thing always, with a focus on safety – in the air, on the ground and in our workplaces. A team who values real diversity and inclusion, in a big brand with big ambitions.

What you'll be doing

As the Lead Business Analyst, Planning & Delivery, you’ll be the bridge between technology and business strategy — helping shape how we plan, prioritise, and deliver technology initiatives across the organisation. You’ll orchestrate annual and quarterly planning cycles that align technology investments with organisational objectives, combining analytical rigour with strategic thinking to ensure resources are allocated where they create the most value.

This is a new and evolving role — there’s no established process (yet). You’ll play a key part in building, testing, and refining how we plan and track technology delivery. It’s an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives in this environment and isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves to make things happen.

We’re not looking for someone who just knows the theory — we want a hands-on doer who’s happy to dive in, figure things out, and continuously improve as we go.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic planning: Lead annual and quarterly technology planning cycles, aligning priorities with strategic objectives and organisational goals.
Stakeholder engagement: Partner with Technology, Finance, Delivery and Executive teams to gather insights, surface dependencies, and influence decision-making.
Governance and process improvement: Design, test, and refine planning frameworks, tools, and planning governance processes that balance flexibility with accountability.
Portfolio insight: Work with the Manager, Reporting & Governance to maintain visibility across the technology portfolio, track progress and dependencies, and provide data-driven analysis to support trade-off decisions.
Continuous improvement: Identify opportunities to enhance planning efficiency, delivery velocity, and transparency across the technology function.
Build from scratch: Establish foundational processes, templates, and routines that will mature as the function grows — you’ll be shaping how this capability operates for years to come.

You’ll be great in this role if you have…

A relevant degree and 5+ years’ experience in business analysis, strategic planning, or management consulting
Proven experience leading enterprise-level planning or portfolio processes
Exceptional communication and influencing skills, with confidence presenting to Leadership
The drive to get things done — you’re proactive, adaptable, and not afraid to take ownership in an unstructured environment
Strong analytical capability and planning acumen, with a talent for turning data into insights
Proficiency in financial modelling, data analysis, and business intelligence tools
A solid understanding of technology delivery and governance framework

For this role you’ll  ideally be based at our Brisbane HQ ,though we also have a Sydney office and welcome applicants based there who are open to travel between locations.

We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):

Flexible Hybrid working arrangements (*This will take effect after the training period)
Discounted flights for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
Discounts on travel insurance, lounge membership, car hire, accommodation, and experiences worldwide
Cheaper hospitality, retail, technology, beauty, and wellness services
Free counselling and access to a wellbeing app to support your physical, mental, social and financial health
Dress for Your Day’ – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever makes you feel great for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you.
One of Brisbane’s most admired head office locations, with South Bank train station, a supermarket, pharmacy, and lunch options downstairs plus a 5-minute walk to the Busway, a rooftop restaurant and onsite gym (with a low membership fee) and South Bank Parklands just across the road

When everyone is included, everyone wins

We’re all individuals. And we love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.

Ready to apply? We’re ready to hear from you. Apply now

Company description:



Future Generation Joint Venture (FGJV) is the principal contractor for Snowy Hydro's Snowy 2.0, Australia's largest committed renewable energy project. We bring the combined engineering expertise of three companies - Italy's Webuild (formerly Salini Impregilo), Australian-based Clough and US-based Lane Construction.

Snowy 2.0 is the next chapter in the Snowy Scheme's history. It is the largest committed renewable energy project in Australia and will provide on-demand energy and large-scale storage for many generations to come. This Iconic Project has and will continue to create its own legacy in Australian history.



Job description:



Are you passionate about transforming data into insights that protect people and the planet? We're looking for a HSE Data Analyst to join our QHSE team and help deliver one of Australia's most iconic infrastructure projects.

Why You'll Love This Role

✅ Be the data powerhouse behind health, safety, and environmental performance
✅ Work with cutting-edge tools like Power BI to create dashboards and reports that matter
✅ Collaborate across teams and influence decisions that keep people safe and protect the environment
✅ Enjoy a dynamic role where every insight counts

What You'll Do

📊 Collect, analyse, and interpret HSE data to identify trends and support risk management
🖥 Manage HSE management software and ensure data integrity across multiple sites
📈 Develop dashboards and reports that tell the story behind the numbers
🎓 Train teams on data systems and champion best practices
🚀 Stay ahead of industry trends and help us innovate

What We're Looking For

🎓 Cert IV in Business Administration or related field (Workplace Health & Safety preferred)
📅 3-5 years' experience in HSE administration
💻 Advanced Excel skills and Power BI super-user status
🔍 A keen eye for detail, strong communication skills, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment

What's in It for You

🌏 Be part of a landmark project in the Snowy Mountains
🤝 Work in a collaborative, forward-thinking team
📚 Opportunities for growth and development
💡 A role where your work truly makes a difference

Ready to turn data into action? Apply now and help us build a safer, more sustainable future!.



We offer:


The FGJV Retention Bonus Scheme
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

Company description:



Future Generation Joint Venture (FGJV) is the principal contractor for Snowy Hydro's Snowy 2.0, Australia's largest committed renewable energy project. We bring the combined engineering expertise of three companies - Italy's Webuild (formerly Salini Impregilo), Australian-based Clough and US-based Lane Construction.

Snowy 2.0 is the next chapter in the Snowy Scheme's history. It is the largest committed renewable energy project in Australia and will provide on-demand energy and large-scale storage for many generations to come. This Iconic Project has and will continue to create its own legacy in Australian history.



Job description:



Are you passionate about transforming data into insights that protect people and the planet? We're looking for a HSE Data Analyst to join our QHSE team and help deliver one of Australia's most iconic infrastructure projects.

Why You'll Love This Role

✅ Be the data powerhouse behind health, safety, and environmental performance
✅ Work with cutting-edge tools like Power BI to create dashboards and reports that matter
✅ Collaborate across teams and influence decisions that keep people safe and protect the environment
✅ Enjoy a dynamic role where every insight counts

What You'll Do

📊 Collect, analyse, and interpret HSE data to identify trends and support risk management
🖥 Manage HSE management software and ensure data integrity across multiple sites
📈 Develop dashboards and reports that tell the story behind the numbers
🎓 Train teams on data systems and champion best practices
🚀 Stay ahead of industry trends and help us innovate

What We're Looking For

🎓 Cert IV in Business Administration or related field (Workplace Health & Safety preferred)
📅 3-5 years' experience in HSE administration
💻 Advanced Excel skills and Power BI super-user status
🔍 A keen eye for detail, strong communication skills, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment

What's in It for You

🌏 Be part of a landmark project in the Snowy Mountains
🤝 Work in a collaborative, forward-thinking team
📚 Opportunities for growth and development
💡 A role where your work truly makes a difference

Ready to turn data into action? Apply now and help us build a safer, more sustainable future!.



We offer:


The FGJV Retention Bonus Scheme
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Paid Parental Leave
Qantas Club Membership discounts
Professional Development
